titles.title: Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns / Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns (fols. 2ra-66vc) II) Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service (fols. 67ra-110vb).

txstates.txstate: All fols. are affected by humidity; the text is partly illegible due to water stains: e.g., fols. 9vc, 10ra, 17vc, 18ra, 20ra. The leather cover is damaged at the spine cover and at the front board. Tears or holes amended on fols. 69, 72, 110.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double line fillet, single circle, single dot, single line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(1; s.l.: 1, no stub/fol. 1r-v) - I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(10/fols. 50r-59v) – VIII(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1; 7, stub before 1/fols. 60r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(5; s.l.: 2, stub after 4/fols. 107r-111v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A-1A-1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines on the incipit page of Texts I and II, alternating with black lines; elements of musical notation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of punctuation signs and text dividers. Text I: Names of sections (zǝmmare) followed by feast or day names and occasionally preceded by the date; names of subsections and their abbreviations (e.g., mänfäs, ṣǝwwaʿ). Text II: Names of antiphons (mäwaśǝʾt) followed by feast or day names; names of sections of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝlṭan, ʿadi); names of the categories of melody and their abbreviations (e.g., ʿǝzl, ʾararay).

abbreviations.abbreviation: Some of the abbreviations used throughout the text: ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ (e.g., fols. 87vc, 98vb) ዕ፡/ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ (e.g., fol. 104rb) ጽዋ፡ for ጽዋዕ፡ (e.g., fols. 12vb, 22rb) ዝማ፡ for ዝማሬ፡ (e.g., fols. 50vc, 65vc) መ፡/መን፡ for መንፈስ፡ (e.g., 22ra, 50vb) አራ፡/አራራ፡ for አራራይ፡ (e.g., 78rb, 106rc)

extras.extra: - Fol. 1 originates from another manuscript (15th century?) and serves as an endleaf. It enumerates the commemorative days of saints and martyrs. - The title of the book is written on fol. 111rb. - Erasures: fol. 21rc. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 14vb, 47vc, 67va, 78rb, 80rc, 81ra. - Immediate corrections marked by thin lines or dashes above and below the words: e.g., fols. 9rb, 34rb, 45rb. - Omitted passages written in the margin or interlineally: e.g., fols. 12rc, 14vb, 18rc, 20r, 23ra, 26va. - Sign, in the shape of a cross with a loop at the end of each arm, written in the margin: fols. 24r, 26r. - Musical notation signs added in recent blue ballpoint pen: fol. 72ra. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 35r, 44v, 73rv, 74r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Threads have been inserted in the upper corner or outer margin of fols. 30, 46, 58, 60, 62.

frames.frame: - Fol. 2r (Incipit page of Text I): uncoloured ornamental band with four lateral extensions; anthropomorphic motifs (faces). - Fol. 67r (Incipit page of Text II): uncoloured ornamental band with four lateral extensions; anthropomorphic motifs (faces).
